text: I could tell you the very first movie
that I remember going to at least had a
really profound effect on me was the
very first Indiana Jones I was eight
years old I was in Charlotte North
Carolina I'll never forget it it was
sold out that was the movie I thought
wow I would love to do that one day I
would love to be that guy interesting
enough the only issue was I didn't grow
up in in a Hollywood family my family
wasn't studio executives or actors so
there was no connection I wasn't quite
too sure how I was gonna make it how
that was gonna happen but I was hoping
one day that would I wanted to be a
cross between Harrison Ford and Elvis
Presley I was such a big fan of Elvis
and I remember saying to my mom at that
time like I want to be him and Elvis and
she was of course you know sure honey
absolutely there was a certain magic
that I didn't know that I didn't quite
know we were gonna we were gonna capture
when I was kissing Steve Carell and we
did we kissed and frankly in this first
time I said this publicly I felt
something I felt something more than I
typically do in acting and for that
sometimes in life and this is one of
those moments where there are no words
and he was he was really amazing
I could go on and on I fell in love with
a game of football and I started playing
football when I was 14 years old but
first my position was left out because
it wasn't that good football was a way
out I spent a lot of time trying to stay
on the right path I was doing a lot of
things that I should have been doing
when I was young when I was a teenager
and pay the price for them I was
arrested a couple of times and I was
really lucky that I had a coach who
eventually became a father figure in my
life who saw the potential in me even
though I didn't see the potential myself
at that time I've got I've got some
pretty good hands yeah they are they are
good hands they I always say these hands
will take care of you when I was 15 or
16 years old I went on an addition for
for soap opera and I forgot which one it
was I drove to New York we're downtown
and I read for it and I had no acting
experience at all I probably got through
four lines before they had said that's
fantastic but you know what I think
we're gonna go into a different
direction thank you very much and I was
like oh okay great but I did great he
knows it's very genuine I'd do good I
wanted feedback and they were like yeah
sure no you did you did great absolutely
somebody get that cardboard box and just
said of here because it probably just
the same and then I had another audition
with Steven summers that was my big
audition for The Mummy Returns I had one
line in the movie and that wasn't even
English it was Egyptian dialogue it was
Akuma Shante and I'll never forget it it
probably means are you silly enough to
actually say these lines and I was at
that time self-deprecating humor is my
favorite type of type of humor if
there's one comedic actor that I aspired
to be like for years and still do and I
admire him greatly it would be Gene
Wilder you have a guy who was so honest
in his performances and his eyes never
lie and but yet at the same time you
know there's great subtleties and truth
in his performances that make it just so
incredibly funny even though I was doing
my first three or four movies where
action movies I was trying to inject as
much humor as I possibly could in them I
do believe that there was a great
benefit in playing football at that
level College prepares you for life but
then when you have the added element of
being a student athlete that requires a
great deal of responsibility and
capacity and it's a lot of pressure
certainly by comparison you know it's
not like you're a soldier and I'm lucky
that I have some family members who are
incredible soldiers too so I think that
football or certainly military will
prepare you for life
you
